Package com.gpch.mongo.service

Class EventService

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gpch.mongo.service.EventService

  • @Service
public class EventService
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Gage Hoefer This class functions as the primary point of contact for all service methods involving Event objects- it relies on the built in services offered by the EventRepository class. These services include saving an event to the database, deleting a event (or events) from the database, and manipulating the information stored in an Event object in the database.

      • saveEvent

        public Event saveEvent​(Event event)
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Event This method is given an Event object, and uses an instance of the EventRepository class to save the Event to the database.

      • getAllEvents

        public java.lang.Iterable<Event> getAllEvents​()
        Returns:
        Iterable This method uses an instance of the EventRepository class to retrieve all Events stored in the database, returning them in the form of an iterable list of Events.

      • deleteEventById

        public void deleteEventById​(java.lang.String id)
        Parameters:
        id - This method is given a String representing the id for a specific Event object, and uses an instance of the EventRepository class to delete the Event corresponding to said id.

        Parameters:
        id -
        Returns:
        Optional This method is given a String representing the id for a specific Event object, and uses an instance of the EventRepository class to retrieve the event corresponding to said id, returning it in the form of an Optional object of type Event.

      • addUserJob

        public void addUserJob​(java.lang.String event_id,
                       java.lang.String user_id,
                       java.lang.String job_id)
        Parameters:
        event_id -
        user_id -
        job_id - This method is given a String representing the event id for a specific Event object, a String representing a user id, and a String representing a job id; with these, the method uses an instance of the EventRepository class to create a UserJob object, and adds it to the list of UserJobs associated with the Event corresponding to said event id.

      • deleteUserJob

        public void deleteUserJob​(java.lang.String event_id,
                          UserJob user_job)
        Parameters:
        event_id -
        user_job - This method is given a String representing the event id for a specific Event stored in the database, and a UserJob object; with these, it uses an instance of the EventRepository class to delete the UserJob from the list of UserJobs associated with the Event corresponding to said event id.

      • setEventId

        public void setEventId​(java.lang.String event_id,

        Parameters:
        event_id -
        new_id - This method is given a String representing the event id for a specific Event stored in the database, and a String representing a new event id; with these, the method uses an instance of the EventRepository class to set the new event id of the Event corresponding to said event id.

      • getAllUserJobsForEvent

        public java.util.List<UserJob> getAllUserJobsForEvent​(java.lang.String event_id)
        Parameters:
        event_id -
        Returns:
        List This method is given a String representing the event id for a specific Event stored in the database, and uses an instance of the EventRepository class to retrieve all UserJobs associated with the Event corresponding to said event it; it returns these in the form of a list of UserJobs.
